media.credit: Acer Chromebook 15' flickr photo by pestoverde shared under a Creative Commons (BY) license

text.headline: Secondary Technology Champions Pilot
text.text: 75 teachers selected to work toward earning a Chromebook cart.

text.headline: Google for administrators
text.text: Administrators trained in Google productivity tools.

media.url: [I was] dreading the Google training, but realized it's not as challenging as I thought. I am excited to use more than I have. Thank you for making it relevant and easy!
media.caption: Jennifer Hinman, Assistant Principal, Bristol Elementary School

text.headline: Canvas for TCTs
text.text: In-depth training for TCTs to begin using Canvas.

text.headline: Team Formation
text.text: The Technology Integration Team officially meets

media.credit: Urban zebras. flickr photo by bennettscience shared under a Creative Commons (BY) license

text.headline: Chromebook carts delivered
text.text: Teachers who successfully compelted the TCT coursework received their Chromebook carts for the start of the fall semester.

text.headline: Phase 1, Cohort 1
text.text: Phase one of three for teachers wanting to work toward a device cart for their classrooms. 131 teachers in Cohort 1.

media.credit: Teacher collaboration flickr photo by bennettscience shared under a Creative Commons (BY) license

text.headline: Phase 1, Cohort 2
text.text: 51 teachers attended a 1-day Phase 1 workshop (8 hours)

text.headline: 1:1 Committee meeting
text.text: The first meeting of the 1:1 device selection committee. Comprised of administrators, teachers, technology services staff, and instructional technology specialists.

media.credit: Meeting room flickr photo by bennettscience shared under a Creative Commons (BY) license

text.headline: Phase 1, Cohort 3
text.text: 61 teachers trained.

text.headline: Phase 2, Cohort 1
text.text: Phase II builds on the skills developed in Phase I. Teachers who complete this section receive 10 devices for their classroom.

text.headline: Google Briefing
text.text: The 1:1 Selection Committee travelled to Chicago to learn more about Google's offerings with Chromebooks in education.

media.credit: From above... flickr photo by bennettscience shared under a Creative Commons (BY) license

text.headline: First 100 Days of School
text.text:
• 3500+ PGPs awarded
  • 3,000+ Chromebooks deployed
  • 700+ teachers trained

media.credit: Calendar flickr photo by boxman shared under a Creative Commons (BY-NC) license

text.headline: Apple briefing
text.text: The 1:1 committee travelled to the Apple Executive Briefing Center in Chicago to learn about the iPad in education.

media.credit: Look up flickr photo by bennettscience shared under a Creative Commons (BY) license

text.headline: 1:1 Device Selection
text.text: The 1:1 Committee unanimously decides to purchase iPads as the student computing device in Elkhart's 1:1 program.

media.credit: student_ipad_school - 250 flickr photo by flickingerbrad shared under a Creative Commons (BY) license

text.headline: Monday Beginner classes
text.text: Introductory courses for tentative users are held every Monday on a variety of tools, mainly focusing on Google and Canvas and their use in the district.

text.headline: Phase 1, Cohort 4
text.text: 40 teachers, first group with iPads.

text.headline: Phase 2, Cohort 2
text.text: 81 teachers (planned)

text.headline: Instructional Cycle
text.text: Summer professional development and curriculum buidling.

text.headline: Strategic Plan Adopted
text.text: Elkhart Community Schools commits to building digital resources for students.

text.headline: Canvas LMS
text.text: Canvas adopted as the LMS for Elkhart Community Schools

text.headline: G Suite
text.text: Teachers and students given access to all GSuite tools.

text.headline: Innovation Planning Grant
text.text: $30,000 from IDOE to prepare and plan implementation of a 1:1 learning program.

text.headline: Professional Development
text.text: Equipping teachers to design engaging digital curriculum.

text.headline: Curriculum Writing
text.text: Dedicated time to collaboatively curate master courses in Canvas.

media.credit: IMG_20161114_135742 flickr photo by bennettscience shared under a Creative Commons (BY) license

text.headline: Device Purchases
text.text: Enable the Instructional Technology team to work more efficiently in supporting district-wide training and curriculum development.

media.credit: Using iPads flickr photo by cogdogblog shared under a Creative Commons (BY) license

text.headline: Professional Learning Center
text.text: Elkhart Education Foundation helped revamp our professional learning center for staff support.

text.headline: Efficacy
text.text: On-demand support, communication, team efficiency
